titles.title: Women's Business Center Amendments Act of 1999
Women's Business Center Amendments Act of 1999
To amend the Small Business Act to change the conditions of participation and provide an authorization of appropriations for the women's business center program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Small Business. H. Rept. 106-47.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 29.

action.text: Mrs. Kelly moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 774.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 385 - 23 (Roll no. 51).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/23/1999--Introduced. Women's Business Center Amendments Act of 1999 - Amends the Small Business Act, with respect to the women's business center program, to: (1) revise the non-Federal contributions requirement for the fifth year of program participation; and (2) increase the annual authorization of appropriations under such program.
